meanings.definition: A tendency that opposes or goes against another tendency.
meanings.sent1: Her countertendency to procrastinate often led to late submissions.
meanings.sent2: The countertendency to save money clashed with her impulse to splurge on unnecessary items.
meanings.sent3: His countertendency to always take the scenic route made their road trips much longer.
meanings.sent4: The countertendency of the rebellious teenager to defy authority caused tension at home.
meanings.sent5: The countertendency of the pendulum swinging back and forth demonstrated the law of physics in action.
